title: Add weekday program slots to Program Schedule

requirements.text: Update the backend Program data model and schedule storage to support weekday-specific program slots, allowing programs to be assigned to specific weekdays (Monday through Friday) with start time, end time, name, and description fields.

quotes: Add a weekday program slots for Program Schedule

acceptanceCriteria: Program data type includes a day field that accepts weekday values (Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday) in addition to any existing day formats
Multiple program slots can be created for different weekdays
Existing weekend or all-day programs are unaffected by the change

requirements.text: Update the ManagePrograms admin page to allow admins to create, edit, and delete program slots specifically for weekdays (Monday–Friday). The add/edit dialog form must include a day-of-week selector field offering at minimum the five weekday options.

quotes: Add a weekday program slots for Program Schedule

acceptanceCriteria: The add/edit program dialog includes a day selector with at least Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, and Friday as options
Saving a program with a weekday selection persists the correct day to the backend
Weekday programs appear in the program list with their associated day label

requirements.text: Update the public SchedulePage to display program slots grouped or labeled by weekday (Monday through Friday), so listeners can browse what shows are scheduled on each day of the week.

quotes: Add a weekday program slots for Program Schedule

acceptanceCriteria: The Schedule page shows program entries with their associated weekday clearly labeled
Programs are visually grouped or sorted by weekday (Mon–Fri)
If no programs are scheduled for a weekday, that day shows an appropriate empty state or is omitted
The OnAirDisplay and UpcomingShows components correctly match current weekday programs against the current day and time

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui
All backend logic must remain in the single actor in backend/main.mo
nonGoals: Changing the overall Christmas-themed visual design
Modifying the Live365 stream player or NowPlaying integration
